intro: Borreria nesiotica, commonly known as the Mexican redroot, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. Borreria nesiotica is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
